discussion.content:
B
The effect of CPU operation on convergence is far less significant than the presence or absence of a feasible successor. Therefore, it is always recommended to ensure that a feasible successor is present.

questions.question_text: Which unique EIGRP feature allows for faster Layer 3 convergence?
EIGRP uses which algorithm to build a routing table?

discussion.content:
C
the Diffusing Update ALgorithm, is the algorithm used by Cisco's EIGRP routing protocol to ensure that a given route is recalculated globally whenever it might cause a routing loop. It was developed by J.J. Garcia-Luna-Aceves at SRI International.

questions.question_text: To which network layer should Cisco Express Forwarding be tuned to support load balancing and to make more informed forwarding decisions?

An HSRP design requirement states that preemption must be enabled for the active switch, which is a Cisco 4507R. Assume a boot time of 300 seconds. Which setting of the preemption delay timer minimizes the loss of traffic?

discussion.content: Based on Arch book and CBT Nuggets Videoes, The Delay should be 50% of the bootup time of the device. So 150 is correct.
The delay of 50% happens after the link comes back, so if boot took 300ms, the delay should be configured for 50% of this 300ms. 150 is correct for me.
Cisco say value should be 50% greater than boot time. In this case, should be 450s. So, 200s is the best answer. The answer of 150s is 50% of boot time - think this is wrong!
On some other dumps, the answer is 200.

choices.A: denies the client network resource access
choices.D: permits the client but limits to guest access

questions.question_text: What is the next action taken by the Cisco NAC Appliance after it identifies a vulnerability on a client device?

discussion.content:
this is a dilemma found this:
The recommended practice is to measure the system boot time, and set the HSRP preempt delay with the standby preempt delay minimum command to 50 percent greater than this value
SO THIS SUGGESTS 200 no ?
A ist correct. I dont even know how should NAC repair a device?

Hi Bella.
Very surprised reading the opposite at same your link.
 Q. How is a noncompliant machine blocked?
A. The Cisco NAC Appliance blocks by either logical or physical means. When deployed inline, the Cisco NAC Appliance is IP-independent and controls admission of noncompliant wireless or wired users by restricting them to a particular subnet and even generating a nonbroadcast, multiaccess topology for virtual segmentation. When deployed out-of-band, the Cisco NAC Appliance "blocks" noncompliant users at a port layer, preventing them from accessing the network until they pass inspection.
